agent_utterance: Tonight, at the first urge you notice, pause for 2 minutes and perform a quick reset: take 6 slow breaths, drink a glass of water, then log one sentence about what you will eat at your next meal and one non-eating coping action (for example a short walk or a quick tidy task). This small, structured step helps move you toward a calmer, more consistent routine.

agent_utterance: When the urge hits, try a quick, repeatable 'pause and plan' routine you can use even on tough days: 1) spend 60 seconds noticing body tension and releasing it (a brief body scan), 2) take three slow breaths, 3) immediately log your next meal plan and one easy coping action you’ll use today (for example a short walk or a glass of water). Keep it under two minutes and reuse it with every urge. This tiny, reliable habit supports steady progress toward your goal, even during mood swings.
